questions.question: I …………………………… the bags on the table.
questions.description: To lay is to put something down. Laid is the past tense of lay.

questions.question: I earn …………………………. money than a sweeper.
questions.description: We use less with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: I ……………………………… to ride a bicycle.
questions.description: Know cannot be followed directly by an infinitive.

questions.question: Every country has ………………………………. traditions.
questions.description: It's means it is or it has.

questions.question: An enormous frog sat ………………………………. the grass.
‘I am hungry.’ ‘……………………………’
questions.description: We use ‘so + auxiliary + subject’ to add a positive remark to another positive sentence.

questions.question: ‘I don’t like cricket.’ ‘…………………………. do I.’
questions.description: We use neither to add a negative addition to a negative idea.

questions.question: Seldom ……………………………….. seen such a dangerous animal.
questions.description: Inversion is used after negative or restrictive words like hardly, seldom, little, rarely etc.

questions.question: At no time …………………………………. aware of what was happening.
questions.description: Inversion is used after negative or restrictive words like hardly, seldom, little, rarely etc.

questions.question: Little …………………………………. realize the danger she faced.
questions.description: Inversion is used after negative or restrictive words like hardly, seldom, little, rarely etc.

questions.question: I was ………………………………. if you could help me.
questions.description: We do not normally use think before indirect questions.

questions.question: She asked ……………………………… I could help.
questions.description: Both if and whether can be used to introduce indirect questions.
